review: Strattera (atomoxetine):Strattera almost ruined my life. First of all, it didn't help my severe ADHD at all. It caused me to have severe nausea every day, dizziness,  insomnia every night and it caused severe aggression and mood changes on just 40 mg for two months. The first day my doctor moved me up to 80 mg it sent me into an induced psychosis state where I wound up fracturing my foot and dislocating my finger so bad that I may have to have surgery. I've been in a splint for almost two months now since that horrible night and scariest part of all is I don't even remember how it happened. It literally caused me to go insane. This drug was the worst drug I've ever taken and it even warns you on the bottle "Warning: May cause mood changes" boy, what an understatement. This medication made me so angry all the time. What they don't tell you about this medication is it can cause induced psychosis and violent behavior. It states that on the FDA website. I was only on straterra for two month's! Very dangerous drug!

Strattera (atomoxetine):Once I took this medicine I could see what I couldn’t before. It doesn’t feel anything and that’s the best part of it. And you can get things done real quick. It affected my sleep a little though.
Strattera (atomoxetine):This drug has an awful side effects, I wouldn’t recommend it for any healthy person.

Strattera (atomoxetine):I tried Strattera for 6 weeks, but wasn’t able to continue waiting for it to work for me due to the fact that I had horrible side effects. Blood pressure increased quickly, my hands turned yellow (!) one day, and it gave me horrible heartburn to the point I would have to wake up every morning at 4 am and make a full meal to get myself back to bed. Word to the wise: get your blood pressure checked!

I have been taking strattera for 7 weeks. The first 4 weeks I had terrible nausea and diarrhea, could not take meds without a big/protein heavy breaky . I immediately lost 5 lbs due to reduced appetite. I started noticing flat affect and low mood at around this time and at week 7 I'm going off of it. it feels like I'm totally removed/disconnected from social situations and nothing is funny/interesting to me. It seems to have made me more depressed than when I started simply because I don't feel present. Also has given me major fatigue. Oversleeping most days and having to nap during the day to keep energy up to functional level. Hopefully I don't get withdrawal symptoms!

So its only my 3rd day on this med, and its true that I am so sleepy. But after reading the reviews, super impressive, I was going to ask for something else but totally changed my mind. I'm gonna stick with it! Thanks everyone!

It has done wonders for my emotional dysregulation and comorbid anxiety disorder. It's somewhat less effective in helping me manage my focus, but there are definitely some improvements.I can't take it on an empty stomach or I will get a horrible nausea. On each dose increase it induced strong drowsiness and made me irritable for a few days.

Strattera (atomoxetine):Been taking strattera for about a month now and I have to say 40mg is definitely enough for me. First day I took stattera, I was a little dizzy but was able to shake it off then proceeded to take 40mg for the next 2 days. I was told I could take 80mg daily but found out that was way too much for me personally and ended up throwing up an hour later after taking it. Everyones different, so don't go off of what I've said with the dosage part, but its very effective for getting noise out of your head. I can pay attention better than I ever have in my entire life.

Strattera (atomoxetine):40 mg twice per day. Noticed much improved attention and focus within the first few days. However, I'm now on week 3 and I feel as if it has almost stopped working. I know it takes a while to build up in your system so I'll stick with it for a while and hopefully it will go back to being effective. I do have moderate issues with delays in urination... sometimes it takes up to a minute for me to "get things started".

I started taking this 2 weeks ago for ADHD. I take one in the morning, and one around 2/3. They make me feel a little loopy and extremely tired by the end of the day. Not sure if that’s normal or not. But I’ve noticed that I stop daydreaming in class as much and I have more motivation after I take them. I do get a little hot natured on them though.

Strattera (atomoxetine):Hi I’m a 27 y/o man I was under care I have been on treatment with this drug.  I will tell you, I took the drug in Italy (I am a double citizen) when I was 7 years old more or less, and I was under treatment until I was 17. Mine is a somewhat particular path I have moved a lot with my family between US and Europe.  I speak 3 languages, I managed to go to university to pass admission tests to the HTZ in Zurich (third best university in the world), and I graduated with excellent results (as a construction engineer), I lead my life perfectly. I'm a 24 year old female recently diagnosed with inattentive ADHD and anxiety. I've always struggled with both of those conditions and finally decided to ask the doctor for help. At first I was on 25mg twice a day. After 4 weeks I didn't feel any different and only had dry mouth as a symptom. My doctor upped my dose to 40mg twice a day and after 3-4 weeks on that dose, one day I realized I felt so much better. I felt so calm, like I had just meditated but all the time. When there was a chore I needed to do like cleaning dishes I just did it, no thinking required. My nighttime routine took me less than 10 minutes when it usually takes an hour. Everything was suddenly so crisp and clear like the fog I was used to living my life in was just gone. When I had to assign my intern something, instead of feeling super anxious and needing to psych myself up for it like I had the previous week, I just was able to do it. It doesn't solve all of my issues, but it really really takes the edge off.

I am a 51 yo female with depression, anxiety & recently diagnosed with ADHD. I have had bad luck with mental health medications & providers in the past, so until about 9 months ago, I was self-treating with alcohol. Because I was honest about that, my current psych med provider refused to treat my ADHD with anything but Strattera. It turned out to be a disaster. I started out on 25mg, then he upped it to 40mg, and then to 80mg. After two days on 80mg, I started having heart palpitations & ended up in urgent care. It turns out that this medication caused me to have PVCs (premature ventricular contractions) and I am now taking a beta-blocker. Not fun. I would definitely THINK TWICE before taking this medication… it is not a first choice for any kind of ADHD.
Strattera (atomoxetine):Have mild ADHD and also chronic depression. All Strattera did for me, after months of use, was tank my appetite and make me not want to eat. Worthless drug for me.

31 years old and I was Just diagnosed with having ADHD. I never had a clue that ADHD was a cause for all the issues I’ve been dealing with for well over a decade. Doc prescribed me Atomoxetine. I started off with 40 mg for the 1st 7 days and then on the 8th day, it was increased to 60mg. Literally, the first day I could feel it. I was incredibly focused, my mind was able to process things easier, I had barely any anxiety, all around the first day felt like a breeze. No stress at all. Felt like an entirely different person. I felt like this for the majority of the 23 days I was on this medication. The negatives to this drug were it made my insomnia even worse and I eventually broke out in hives! I was barely sleeping but somehow I was still feeling okay for most of the day even with the lack of sleep. That’s the weird part. I stopped it cold Turkey and experienced horrible headache and cloudy brain for 5 days.
Strattera (atomoxetine):Initially use was good-calm and focused. As progressed I was unable to work up to full 80mg dose. Nausea, dizziness, sour stomach daily
I took it for about a year, helps with hyperactivity not much with attention deficit

Strattera (atomoxetine):Not for me, may work for others. Was prescribed a non stimulant because I go to a government funded clinic that doesn't give out stimulants due to drug abuse in the area. I personally think this doesn't stop our high addiction rates, people will always get their fixes, but instead just makes it harder for people that need it to get the help they need.First you have take it after a meal to avoid the violent nausea. I'm a very spotty eater and in the morning I don't want to eat at all but that's the best time to take it to get any benefit with such a short halflife. So I compromised and do it at lunch, still no real benefits. The medicine's short halflife gets absorbed by anything used to mitigate or fight its effects: sleeping to counteract the drowsiness, food to combat the nausea, battling through nausea is near impossible or exhausting so its benefits are wasted.

Strattera (atomoxetine):26 yr old 3 weeks on 40 mg StratteraThe first few days I was slightly nauseous for an hour and felt on edge with the smallest things. Day one I fell asleep unintentionally for 2 hrs after work. The tiredness has not yet left.  Currently the nausea has pretty much gone away but I feel distant from what’s going on around me.  I zone out in thought and and don’t feel motivated where before the medication I would have moment of energy to get something done and hopefully finish it.  I’m drinking coffee all day to stay awake and it not having much of an effect. I have noticed the racing thoughts and the need to be doing something  has gone away but almost in a bad way. All the reviews are saying to give it 4-6 weeks so I’m hoping for the best. (almost didn’t finish this review because I didn’t care to after starting it)

I understand the same chemicals can have different effects on different people. This drug did very little to help me but had painful side effects which never improved over the 2 months I took atomoxetine. For the first few days, I had painful constipation causing bleeding and hemorrhoids. Urination is slow and painful and often followed by involuntary, even more painful semen discharge.  Around the same time every day, my testes would painfully swell up making all movement difficult. The change was noticeable enough that I was willing to continue taking the medication despite my painful side effects, although after an additional month with no positive difference I could no longer bring myself to continue.
Made me feel like a zombie while just improving an insignificant amount of my symptoms

Strattera (atomoxetine):I tried this medication on several different occasions for at least 3-4 months each go around all at the 80-100mg dosage level.Not only did I quite literally--not notice any positive benefits, but had loads of side effects. Side effects like severe irritability, foggy brain, and lethargy. Combine that with the horrible withdrawals after stopping the medication, or forgetting a dose, and it is an absolute NO GO. Strattera (atomoxetine):I've been taking it for almost 3 months and I'm ditching it. So far I haven't felt almost any improvement except for like 2 or 3 particular days and it has worsen some of my symptoms.
Strattera (atomoxetine):I’ve been on it for 4 months. It literally just doesn’t do anything.

Strattera (atomoxetine):I was recommended a non-stimulant adhd medication by my psychologist because I have tics that a stimulant would make significantly worse. I definitely would not recommend Strattera.

Strattera (atomoxetine):I have "ADHD without hyperactivity (ADHD of the predominantly inattentive type)" I started 2 months ago at 40mg, I feel extremely tired, more distracted than before, my thoughts are like a turbulent river with no sense (Before my mind was silent and sharp), and the heartburn is killing me, is the first time in my life that I wake up because of heartburn pain, and the constipation is so bad that I go to the bathroom every 3 days.I have troubles sleeping more than 3 hours straight, my dreams are weird as, and I'm still gaining weight despite eating once a day (Is not a thyroid problem), which means I'm still extremely lethargic.I need energy and focus, I don't know why they gave me a non stimulant thing.I tried Ritalin before and had no effect on me, but at least there were no side effects.The good side is, now I have new things to worry about besides my poor performance at work.

Don't take this medication unless you don't want to poop or you want to call off sick because you think you have covid or the flu due to the horrible side effects. I would give a zero for the rating. Strattera (atomoxetine):PLEASE READ ENTIRE REVIEW BEFORE TAKING THIS DRUGI am a young, healthy, and well-balanced young male.
